title: Gaayathri
text:
Gaayathri is a 1977 Indian <a href="Tamil%20language">Tamil</a>-language film directed by R. Pattabhiraman and written by <a href="Panchu%20Arunachalam">Panchu Arunachalam</a>. It stars <a href="Jaishankar">Jaishankar</a>, <a href="Rajinikanth">Rajinikanth</a> and <a href="Sridevi">Sridevi</a>. The film was based on the novel of the same name by <a href="Sujatha%20%28writer%29">Sujatha</a>. It was released on 7 October 1977.
Plot.
Rajarathnam is a rich man who lives with his sister Sarasu and a young house maid in <a href="Chennai">Madras</a>. Her sister arranges a marriage for him with Gaayathri, a sixteen-year old who lives in <a href="Tiruchirappalli">Tiruchirappalli</a>. Soon after they marry, Gaayathri moves to Rajarathnam's house and realises that the family has secrets. Rajarathnam is a blue-film producer who records the bedroom scenes of himself with his wife, without her knowledge and sells it on the black market. Gaayathri initially believes Rajarathnam, but later discovers that he was already married to a woman who is now insane. <a href="Ganesh%E2%80%93Vasanth">Ganesh</a>, a friend of the writer Chellappa, realises this and tries to free Gaayathri from the hands of Rajarathnam. But, unfortunately Gaayathri dies in the end.
Production.
"Gaayathri" is based on <a href="Sujatha%20%28writer%29">Sujatha</a>'s novel of the same name, and was conceived during <a href="The%20Emergency%20%28India%29">the Emergency</a>. The screenplay was written by <a href="Panchu%20Arunachalam">Panchu Arunachalam</a>.
Soundtrack.
The soundtrack was composed by <a href="Ilaiyaraaja">Ilaiyaraaja</a>, with lyrics by Arunachalam. Singer <a href="Sujatha%20Mohan">Sujatha Mohan</a> made her debut as a singer through this film.
